title: Turks and Caicos Islands
summary: The Turks and Caicos Islands (abbreviated TCI;[5] /tɜːrks/ and /ˈkeɪkəs, -koʊs, -kɒs/) are a British Overseas Territory consisting of the larger Caicos Islands and smaller Turks Islands, two groups of tropical islands in the Lucayan Archipelago of the Atlantic Ocean and northern West Indies.[6] They are known primarily for tourism and as an offshore financial centre. The resident population was 31,458 in 2012,[3] of whom 23,769 lived on Providenciales in the Caicos Islands; July 2020 estimates put the population at 55,926.[5] It is the third largest of the British overseas territories by population.
